TopicTitle: The Six Words You Never Say at KSC.

Articles.Content:
when will the next patch arrive?

six words!

no other six words are more prohibited than these
I think we're going too fast

I think you're going too slow

You really need some moar boosta !

"This will be a routine launch"

"We don't need those struts there"

"That staging looks good to me"

With rockets, size does not matter.

No need to check my staging.

64 bits is enough for me.

Well, how could it go wrong?

We will not go to space on this.

- - - Updated - - -

Or: Maybe we need better parts

What does this red button do?

I think one parachute is enough.

I do not need puny struts!

Perhaps hyper sonic speed is enough.
"Can we please go home now?"

"This mission may be my last."

But that design is over budget!
Well, heh, contracts aren't far off. Your design might well be over budget after all.
when will the next patch arrive?

six words!

no other six words are more prohibited than these

*cracks knuckles*

Well, yes. Yes, they are. And you just said them.

You'll never see this motto anywhere at KSC,

'ad astra per aspera sine boosters'

Regards.
"Don't worry Jeb, you'll be fine!!"

The six words i never say in KSP:

Everything is just working as expected.

and...

I know exactly what iÃ‚Â´m doing.

But there's already mods for that!

That argument is an invalid reason to say that something should never be put in to the game, because it's already been proven wrong many, many times.

People made mods for career mode style missions before we had 0.22.

People made mods for rovers LONG before we had rover wheels (mods from 0.15 or before, rover wheels in 0.19 or so).

People made mods for docking ports, which actually convinced Harv that it could be done.

Plenty of KSPX parts made it into the game unchanged except for part name. (cupola, LV-1R, 48-7S, Skipper, long radial RCS tank).

ALL of the spaceplane parts we have were mod parts in 0.13 (except for the delta-deluxe winglet).

There's probably more examples of mods being integrated into the game in one form or another, but I think I've made the point.

Shooting down a suggestion for being outside the game's scope is one thing (guns and energy shields for example should stay as mods), but shooting down something like a stock Delta-V display because there are mods for that is just lazy thinking IMO.

At best, "there's already a mod for that" means "it can wait". However, "It can wait" is NOT the same as "It shouldn't ever happen"

If you couldn't tell, those six words are a pet peeve of mine, when used in the "shouldn't ever happen" sense.

-edit-

how do I get these spoiler tags to work?

UH oh, here we go again
"You should add an escape tower"

"I'm not afraid of Space Kraken"

"That's enough fuel to reach Moho."

"Let's land on the Jool surface."
"Where the hell are my resources"
Rocket science is super easy, guys.
You should have used more parts
Relax, I know what I'm doing.
Let's go to Gas Planet 2!
I think I'm done for today.

I think I'm done for today.

Oooh, that's a very good one!

Compliance with six word rule.

Oooh, that's a good one!

That's only a 5 word sentence. Not 6!
